intro: Hieracium neoleontodon, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish to reddish flowers and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat hairy. Hieracium neoleontodon is often found in sunny habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
